definitions: feeling of great happiness and triumph expressed through joyful behavior
act of celebrating or expressing joy through festivities and gatherings
examples: There was great rejoicing when the war finally ended
The rejoicing in her heart couldn't be contained any longer
The streets filled with rejoicing after the team's victory
Their rejoicing lasted throughout the entire weekend celebration

definitions: process of making something look or feel younger, fresher, or more vital
medical or cosmetic procedure designed to restore youthful appearance to skin
examples: The park underwent complete rejuvenation with new plantings and pathways
The rejuvenation of the downtown district attracted many new businesses
She scheduled facial rejuvenation treatments at the dermatology clinic
Laser rejuvenation can reduce wrinkles and improve skin texture significantly

definitions: return of illness or medical condition after period of improvement
return to previous undesirable behavior pattern after attempted change
examples: The patient suffered a relapse after stopping the medication
Cancer relapse rates vary depending on the type and stage
His relapse into alcohol addiction disappointed his family greatly
She experienced a relapse in her eating disorder during stressful times

definitions: returning to a previous worse state after temporary improvement or recovery
examples: The relapsing nature of the disease requires continuous monitoring
Relapsing fever causes recurring episodes of high temperature
Her relapsing depression made consistent treatment absolutely necessary
Relapsing patterns in addiction recovery are unfortunately quite common

definitions: way in which two or more things are connected or associated
person connected to another by blood or marriage ties
correspondence between sets of values or mathematical expressions
examples: The relation between diet and health is well documented
Their business relation lasted for over twenty years successfully
She's a distant relation on my mother's side
All relations were invited to the family reunion gathering
The relation between variables was plotted on the graph
This mathematical relation defines the function's behavior precisely

definitions: way in which two or more people or groups regard and behave toward each other
connection or association between concepts, things, or circumstances
examples: Their relationship grew stronger through shared experiences
She ended the toxic relationship after years of counseling
The relationship between poverty and crime requires careful study
Scientists discovered a relationship between these two phenomena

definitions: person connected by blood or marriage to another person
considered in relation or proportion to something else rather than absolutely
examples: My relatives gather every Thanksgiving for dinner
She's visiting relatives in California this summer
The relative humidity affects how hot it feels
Success is relative to individual goals and circumstances

definitions: philosophical view that truth and moral values are not absolute but relative to context, culture, or individual perspective
examples: Cultural relativism challenges universal moral standards
His embrace of relativism frustrated those seeking absolute truth
Moral relativism suggests ethics vary between different societies
The professor critiqued relativism in her philosophy lecture

definitions: Einstein's theory describing space, time, gravity, and the universe
quality of being relative or existing only in comparison to something else
examples: Einstein's theory of relativity revolutionized modern physics
General relativity explains gravitational effects on spacetime
The relativity of beauty standards varies across cultures
She discussed the relativity of success in her speech

definitions: state of being free from tension and anxiety through rest
process of making muscles less tense through specific techniques
act of making rules or restrictions less strict or severe
examples: She found relaxation in reading books by the fireplace
The spa offers various relaxation treatments and massage therapies
Progressive muscle relaxation helps reduce physical stress
Deep breathing promotes relaxation throughout the entire body
The relaxation of trade restrictions boosted economic growth
Border relaxation allowed more tourists to visit

definitions: race where team members take turns completing segments
electrical switch operated by electromagnet controlling another circuit
act of receiving and passing on information or signals
examples: The swim relay team won gold at the championships
She ran the final leg of the relay race
The electrical relay controls the motor's power supply
A faulty relay caused the system to malfunction
Satellites relay signals across vast distances instantly
Please relay this message to the department head

definitions: act of setting free from confinement or restraint
published or distributed version of a product, especially media
process of letting go of emotional tension or psychological burden
examples: The prisoner's release date was set for next month
The release of the hostages brought international relief
The band's new release topped the charts immediately
The software release included several important security updates
Crying provided emotional release after months of stress
Physical exercise offers healthy release for pent-up frustration

definitions: act of assigning to a lower position, rank, or level of importance
examples: Relegating tasks to junior staff freed up management time
The team feared relegating to the lower division
His boss was relegating him to less important projects
Relegating old files to storage cleared office space

definitions: transfer of sports team to lower division due to poor performance
act of moving something or someone to less important position
examples: The team fought desperately to avoid relegation this season
Relegation meant significant financial losses for the club
His relegation to assistant manager was deeply disappointing
The proposal's relegation to committee meant certain delay

definitions: quality of being closely connected or appropriate to the matter at hand
examples: The relevance of this research to climate change is clear
She questioned the relevance of outdated teaching methods
The document's relevance to the case was immediately apparent
Cultural relevance increases student engagement in learning

definitions: quality of being trustworthy, consistent, and able to be depended upon
examples: The car's reliability made it popular with families
Test reliability ensures consistent results across multiple attempts
Her reliability as an employee earned multiple promotions
System reliability is crucial for emergency services

definitions: state of depending on or trusting in someone or something for support
examples: Their reliance on technology increased during the pandemic
Heavy reliance on fossil fuels damages the environment
His reliance on others prevented personal growth
The company's reliance on one supplier proved risky

definitions: object surviving from earlier time, especially of historical interest
object venerated for association with saint or sacred person
something that has survived from past but is now outdated
examples: The museum displayed relics from ancient civilizations
Archaeological relics provide insights into past cultures
Pilgrims traveled to view the sacred relic
The church houses several important religious relics
That law is a relic from less enlightened times
These customs are relics of colonial rule

definitions: feeling of reassurance and relaxation after anxiety or distress
assistance, especially financial or practical, given to those in need
sculptural technique where forms project from flat background
person who replaces another temporarily in duty or work
examples: She felt immense relief when the test results were negative
The relief on his face was obvious to everyone
Disaster relief arrived within hours of the earthquake
The charity provides relief to families in poverty
The marble relief depicted scenes from ancient mythology
Bas-relief sculptures decorated the temple walls
The relief pitcher warmed up in the bullpen
Night shift relief arrives at midnight

definitions: medication that reduces or eliminates pain or discomfort
person who takes over duties from another, especially in sports
examples: She took a pain reliever for her headache
This fever reliever works within thirty minutes
The relief pitcher was their best reliever all season
The midnight reliever took over security duties

definitions: organized system of beliefs, ceremonies, and rules to worship deity or deities
pursuit or interest to which someone ascribes supreme importance
examples: Christianity is the world's largest religion by number of adherents
She studied comparative religion at the university
Football is practically a religion in this town
He made healthy living his religion

definitions: state or quality of being religious, especially showing strong religious feeling or belief
examples: The community's religiosity was evident in their daily practices
Studies examined the relationship between religiosity and mental health
Her religiosity increased significantly after the near-death experience
Measures of religiosity include church attendance and prayer frequency

definitions: act of voluntarily ceasing to keep or claim something, giving up possession or control
examples: Relinquishing control proved difficult for the longtime CEO
She was relinquishing her rights to the property
The king resisted relinquishing power to parliament
Relinquishing old habits requires conscious effort and time

definitions: pickled or cooked vegetable condiment served with food
great enjoyment or anticipation of something
examples: She added pickle relish to her hot dog
The homemade tomato relish complemented the grilled meat perfectly
He ate with obvious relish after the long hike
She described her adventures with great relish

definitions: action of moving to new place to live or work, especially over significant distance
examples: The company offered relocation assistance to transferred employees
Their relocation to Australia took months of planning
Wildlife relocation programs help protect endangered species
The relocation of the factory created many new jobs

definitions: unwillingness or disinclination to do something, feeling of hesitation before action
examples: Her reluctance to speak publicly was well known
He overcame his reluctance and joined the committee
The board expressed reluctance about the merger proposal
Despite initial reluctance, she accepted the promotion

definitions: part, number, or quantity that is left over after other parts removed
number left over after division that cannot be evenly divided
examples: She spent the remainder of the day reading
The remainder of the food was donated to charity
When dividing seven by three, the remainder is one
Calculate the remainder after performing the division

definitions: new version of existing movie, song, or other creative work
examples: The remake of the classic film disappointed many fans
Hollywood produces countless remakes of foreign movies
Their remake of the song topped the charts
The video game remake featured updated graphics

definitions: process of making something again or differently, especially creative work
examples: They're remaking the entire product line for modern consumers
The director is remaking her first film with better technology
Remaking classics often disappoints original fans
The company focused on remaking its public image

definitions: state of being held in custody pending trial or further legal proceedings
examples: The suspect was held on remand awaiting trial
The judge ordered remand without bail
Prisoners on remand have different rights than convicted inmates
The remand center was overcrowded with awaiting defendants

definitions: spoken or written comment expressing opinion or observation about something
examples: His casual remark offended several people at dinner
She made an interesting remark about the economy
The teacher's encouraging remarks motivated the students
His opening remarks set the tone for the meeting

definitions: act of marrying again after divorce or death of previous spouse
examples: Her remarriage surprised friends who thought she'd remain single
Statistics show remarriage rates have declined recently
His remarriage to his ex-wife made headlines
The children struggled to accept their parent's remarriage

definitions: second contest or game between same opponents, especially after controversial result
examples: The boxing rematch drew even larger crowds
Fans demanded a rematch after the disputed decision
Their chess rematch lasted even longer than the original
The rematch is scheduled for next month

definitions: process of providing remedy or correction, especially in education
action of removing pollution or contaminants from environmental media
examples: Students requiring remediation received extra tutoring sessions
Math remediation programs help struggling learners catch up
Soil remediation at the site took three years
Environmental remediation costs exceeded initial estimates significantly

definitions: medicine or treatment that relieves disease or pain
means of counteracting or eliminating something undesirable
examples: Traditional remedies often use natural herbs and plants
The doctor prescribed a remedy for her persistent cough
Education is the best remedy for ignorance
They sought a legal remedy for the contract breach

definitions: act of recalling or keeping something in one's memory
examples: Remembering names becomes harder with age for many
She had trouble remembering where she parked
Remembering victims of war is important for society
The ceremony focused on remembering fallen heroes

definitions: action of remembering something or someone from the past
ceremony or object serving as memorial to person or event
examples: Her remembrance of childhood was surprisingly detailed
In remembrance of his mother, he planted a tree
The remembrance ceremony honored fallen soldiers
She wore a poppy in remembrance of veterans

definitions: thing that causes someone to remember something, note or alert for this purpose
examples: Set a reminder for your doctor's appointment tomorrow
The photo served as a painful reminder of loss
Email reminders help reduce missed meetings
This scar is a constant reminder of the accident

definitions: story or memory about past events, especially enjoyable ones recalled with pleasure
examples: Grandpa's reminiscences about the war fascinated us
The book is filled with reminiscences of her childhood
Their reminiscence of college days lasted hours
She shared reminiscences of her travels abroad

definitions: temporary diminution or disappearance of disease symptoms
cancellation or reduction of debt, charge, or penalty
examples: The cancer went into remission after chemotherapy treatment
Complete remission lasted for over five years
The bank granted remission of the outstanding loan
Tax remission helped struggling businesses survive

definitions: area of responsibility, authority, or activity assigned to person or organization
examples: Environmental protection falls within the agency's remit
The committee's remit includes budget oversight
This issue is outside our remit as advisors
The remit was expanded to include digital services

definitions: sum of money sent as payment or gift, especially to another country
examples: Monthly remittances support her family back home
Remittance fees can be expensive for small amounts
The remittance arrived just in time for rent
International remittances boost many developing economies

definitions: small remaining quantity or part of something after main part gone
examples: Fabric remnants were perfect for the quilting project
Only remnants of the ancient wall remain standing
The remnants of dinner were saved for tomorrow
Archaeological remnants reveal ancient civilization details

definitions: deep regret or guilt for wrongdoing or harm caused to others
examples: He showed genuine remorse for his actions
The criminal expressed no remorse during sentencing
Remorse consumed her after the harsh words
Living without remorse requires accepting past mistakes

definitions: device for controlling equipment from a distance wirelessly
distant or isolated place far from population centers
examples: The TV remote needs new batteries
She couldn't find the remote under the couch cushions
They lived in a remote mountain village
The research station was in a remote Arctic location

definitions: fresh horse provided as replacement, especially in military or competitive context
examples: The cavalry soldier received a remount after battle
Fresh remounts waited at the relay station
The polo player quickly switched to a remount
Army remounts were essential for long campaigns

definitions: action of taking away or eliminating something from particular place or position
examples: Trash removal occurs every Tuesday morning
The removal of trade barriers boosted commerce
Tumor removal surgery was scheduled immediately
Snow removal costs exceeded the city's budget

definitions: degree of remoteness or separation in relationship or connection
examples: She's my cousin at three removes
The connection was several removes from the original source
At one remove from direct experience
This interpretation is several removes from the author's intent

definitions: money paid for work or services, formal term for salary or payment
examples: Executive remuneration packages included stock options
Fair remuneration attracts qualified professionals
The contract specified remuneration terms clearly
Annual remuneration reviews ensure competitive salaries

definitions: animal fat processed and purified for cooking or industrial use
first coat of plaster applied to brick or stone wall
examples: The butcher sold beef render for cooking
Render from bacon adds flavor to dishes
The render coat must dry before painting
Applying render protects exterior walls from weather
